turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, I just checked my balance and it seems off. There's a transaction labelled 'Misc Debit' that I don't recognize from two days ago.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand that seeing an unfamiliar transaction can be concerning. I can help you investigate the 'Misc Debit' entry. Could you please tell me the exact date and amount of this transaction?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, it was for $75.00 on January 18th. Also, completely unrelated, but I've been trying to set up automatic transfers between my checking and savings accounts, and the option seems to have disappeared from the online portal. What's going on with that?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you for the details on the transaction. Let me look up that specific debit. Regarding the automatic transfers feature, ensure you are logged into the correct account profile and navigating to the 'Transfers' or 'Scheduled Payments' section. Sometimes menu layouts change after updates.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Yes, I am logged into the right place! I've looked *everywhere*. The option for *recurring* transfers between my own accounts just isn't there anymore. It's really frustrating, I used that feature all the time. Are you saying the feature was removed? That can't be right.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Apologies for the confusion. The recurring transfer option between your own accounts hasn't been removed, but its location might have changed slightly in the recent update. It should now be found under 'Move Money' -> 'Transfer Funds' and then selecting the 'Make this a recurring transfer' checkbox after filling in the details. I can also confirm the 'Misc Debit' transaction for $75.00 on January 18th appears to be a fee for an expired overdraft protection service you had previously enrolled in.
